dialogue.raw_text: Eh... you keep it. I've had enough.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What's the matter?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (throws the can to the ground) Shit!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Jenny and the STAR MAN ride along in tight-lipped silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jenny ignores him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She flinches but remains silent. The STAR MAN snatches the paper towel off his lap and flaps it in her face, jabbing at the word violently with a forefinger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jenny can't take it anymore and screams back at him through tears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jenny's outburst rocks the STAR MAN back into silence. He waits for her to calm down, then slowly takes the gun out of his pocket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She doesn't dare look at him.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What is kidnapped?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (yells) Kidnapped!!!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Kidnapped!!! What is kidnapped?!!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Kidnapped is what you're doing to me now!!! Kidnapped is pointing a gun at me and taking me from my house! Kidnapped is changing yourself into my husband. I don't know what you are and I don't care. I just want to get away from you!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Jennyhaydn.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I am good. (and he slides the .45 under his seat)
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Jenny speeds up to pass a truckload of horses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She doesn't answer. The car passes the truck. The highway before them is empty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jenny TURNS ON the RADIO and finds a COUNTRY AND WESTERN STATION.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It is pleasing to him and he listens for a while, then reaches in his pouch and takes out one of the dusty gray marbles. He rolls it between his palms. It changes to a glowing gold as it grows to the size of a baseball.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The STAR MAN brings the globe close to his mouth and speaks into it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The STAR MAN opens his hands and, to Jenny's astonishment, the ball rises quickly and seeps through her roof without leaving a trace.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What is that?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (finally) Horses.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (without looking at her) Horses.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Music.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (alarmed) What are you doing?!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (subtitles) Iron channel message. Transmute was successful. Have captured one of them. It is taking me to the pick-up point in a land vehicle. (eyeing Jenny) I think I can control it by mastering its language, which is primitive and easy to learn. Will arrive on time. Wait for me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The Mustang swerves violently, then straightens itself as the ball comes through the roof and surges into the sky.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Unexpectedly, Shermin's helicopter storms into view. It is so close we can count the rivets. As it clears, we go to:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The flow of traffic on the Interstate below is being fed into the six television screens from infrared cameras on the belly of the craft. The image on the screen under the master begins to move and ends in a close-up of a green Mustang. It's not Jenny's. With a buzz the red dot appears and Fox's face interrupts the view of the Mustang.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shermin rubs his hands over his face while he digests this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His image is replaced by one of the highway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bell and Lyman look at their feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's Shermin's turn to look at his feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On one of the screens behind him the camera has picked up a lighted billboard advertising 'Kellogg's Corn Flakes' with its slogan 'HAVE A GREAT DAY.'
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) I just came from a meeting with the Security Council and (the picture breaks up, but the voice continues) in view of the extraterrestrial's radical change and the fact that all our efforts (the picture re- assembles) to contact its ship remain unanswered, it was decided to issue a ten state 'all points bulletin' for Scott Haydn, Jenny Haydn and the green Mustang. The officers have been instructed not to approach the people or the vehicle but to contact you. You will then move in and contain the subjects.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (sorting it out) You sure you want this, because... that's putting an awful lot of faith in people we have no control over...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) I'm afraid the situation demands that kind of risk.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't like it, George...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Dammit Shermin. Earlier you were asking for help. What's changed?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's messy... the thing's got a gun... We're just asking for somebody to get killed...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) We don't know what else to do. We need results.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (accepting) You'll get results one way or the other, that's for sure... Okay.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) I'm gonna be here if you need anything.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They're gonna let some local cop blow him away.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Save us all a lot of trouble.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Jesus Lyman, you're an ignorant fool.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Bullshit!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You have no conception of this, do you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You jerk! You look at all the sweetness and light and goodness you think'll come out of this. You know what's gonna come out of this... The end of religion, the end of civilization, the end of the earth. We could become slaves, we could become a colony of these things. Don't you see that? Are you too stupid to see that?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Are you ladies through?...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Good... It looks like we might be the welcoming committee, so I think we should try and figure out what we're gonna do if we have to come face to face with this creature.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Bell wants us to get down on our knees and bow.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Bell) Did your people have any contingencies rehearsed?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No... I guess we never thought it would happen.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Terrific.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Jenny's Mustang is barreling along well over the speed limit. As it PASSES US, we PAN WITH it TO a sign: SLOW FOR INTERSECTION.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A truckload of corn is hurtling down ON US from the north. An empty semi is rumbling up from the south. The light is in their favor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The STAR MAN is driving. It is obvious that he doesn't see the red light facing him. But Jenny does. And she also sees the trucks closing in from either side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The STAR MAN doesn't see it, doesn't believe her, doesn't slow down.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (loud) Red light!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (screams) Stop!!!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: It is as if all three vehicles have heard Jenny. They slam on their brakes at the same time and begin to skid toward each other. It's going to be close.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The prows of the trucks loom over Jenny and the STAR MAN and, for a fleeting instant, it looks like they will join the bugs imbedded in the radiators.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Mustang barely squeaks through and the trucks slam into each other behind it, spilling corn all over the highway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It finally comes to a stop on the center line.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The STAR MAN looks back for the traffic light. It is hanging from a pole in the middle of the road. Under it the truck DRIVERS are climbing out of the cabs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The STAR MAN angles back into his lane and begins to pick up speed.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: That was a red light!! I told you you have to stop at a red light!!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (sheepish) It was yellow.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You didn't even see it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I will see it next time.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You better.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Deftly, the STAR MAN moves in and out of the afternoon traffic. A bus coming in the other direction hits a pothole filled with water and the SPLASH covers the Mustang.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jenny watches the STAR MAN calmly turn on the wipers and the washer and clean the windshield. The light above the intersection ahead turns red and, even though he is still fiddling with the wipers, the STAR MAN manages a smooth stop back of the crosswalk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The light changes and the STAR MAN continues down the street.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The answer is hovering above the city in front of them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The STAR MAN is unyielding.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jenny slams herself angrily back in the seat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Her upper lip trembles and, in spite of herself, she might cry. The STAR MAN sees the center lane is open. He checks his side mirror and drifts over, only to be caught by a light. The car is still rolling when Jenny makes her move. She throws open the door and, by the time the STAR MAN turns around, she is out and running.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He takes his foot off the brake to go after her and the car lurches into the cross traffic. He clambers back behind the wheel, regains control and cuts a hard right in front of the other car waiting at the light.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (indicating the red dot on the satel compass) Why are you going here? What is here?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: My... (searches for word) ...car will take me... (pokes finger toward sky) ...up there... home.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (at the red dot again) When do you have to be here?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I do not understand.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (rubs her temples and laments to herself) How will I do this one?...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (pointing to the sun) Sun...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sun... day. No sun... night. You understand?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes. Day... night.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How many days and nights do you have to go... (prods the red dot) ...here?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Three nights... two days.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's not much time. I'll just slow you down. I have to sleep. I'm very tired. And I have to wash and eat. You don't...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I need you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I won't tell anybody if that's what you're worried about. I promise. You'll keep...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You'll keep the car. I'll take a bus... (an awful possibility occurs to her) Am I going up there with you... in your ship... up there?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Then let me go. You don't need me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I feel like I'm going crazy here. You're Scott. But he's dead. I don't know what's real anymore. I can't be here with you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Do you understand what I'm saying to you? You can keep the car. (she hands him some money) That should be enough for gas from here to there. Please let me go.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (taps the red dot on the satel compass) When we get here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You bastard.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Jennyhaydn!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Over her shoulder, Jenny can see the Mustang coming. She dodges up a brick walkway toward a J.C. Penney shopping mall. The Mustang skids to a stop at the curb. The STAR MAN jumps out in time to see Jenny push her way past a stream of pedestrian traffic and enter the mall. He leaves the car and zigzags through the people in that direction.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As he barges in, the STAR MAN accidentally knocks a cup of Coke out of a YOUNG MAN's hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In a panic to find Jenny, he continues jostling past people to look in the shops that border the atrium.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Hey!!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Jenny warily approaches the railing and peers over. Below her the STAR MAN comes out of a record store. She turns away and gets on the escalator to the second floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The STAR MAN thinks he sees Jenny in an electronics store, but when the girl turns around, it is obviously not her. Backing out of there, he knocks over a sandwich board advertising a restaurant. The LOUD THWACK it makes when it hits the cement turns faces in his direction. Jenny's is not among them. His eyes raise to the mezzanine. Maybe she's there. He looks wildly around for a way up. He spots the escalator and, trying to keep the upper floor in view while he runs for it, he slams into an unattended pram. It begins to tip over. The BABY INSIDE SCREAMS. The STAR MAN manages to snatch it out of the carriage before it hits the floor. He is looking for a place to put it when the MOTHER comes charging out of a plant store.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The STAR MAN holds the baby out to her. She grabs it out of his hands and he turns to leave.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Two tough-looking MEN in T-shirts step in to block the STAR MAN's way to the escalator.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not understanding, the STAR MAN tries to get by them. They push him back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A tall, skinny blond man with spectacles elbows his way to the Mother.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Two steps and Burt is on the STAR MAN. He spins him around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He throws him back against the crowd that has gathered.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Burt pulls the STAR MAN up by his shirt front and shakes him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fear erases the STAR MAN's tenuous grasp of English and he begins to jabber in his own language. This makes Burt even madder.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: My baby!!! He's stealing my baby! Burt!!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Burt!! Somebody stop him!! He was stealing my baby!!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Where you think you're going?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Please.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He was trying to steal Gloria.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Is that right? Huh?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (stutters) Please.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Is that right? Come on. Answer me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Were you trying to steal my baby? Huh? Answer me!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Jennyhaydn!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Jenny has just gotten on the escalator to the third floor when she hears her name. She knows she shouldn't but she gets off and joins the crowd at the railing. From there, she can see the STAR MAN trapped in a circle of people. He clubs Burt away from him and tries to thrash his way out of the mob.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One of the T-shirts throws him back and Burt begins to punch him. We MOVE IN UNTIL we are CLOSE ON Jenny's face.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Jennyhaydn!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Some of the onlookers have joined Burt in his attempt to bring the STAR MAN down. Growling in his own language, the STAR MAN fights back as best he can. The sleeve of his windbreaker is torn. One of the T-shirts lands a blow on his right shoulder that turns the STAR MAN around. He takes a blow on the chest. Another in the kidneys. Burt gets a grip on the STAR MAN's left wrist and holds on. The attackers close in. Jenny's voice cuts through the din.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She barges into the fray and starts peeling the men away from the STAR MAN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The men do. Jenny pushes the sleeve of the torn wind-breaker back up on the STAR MAN's shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She starts to push out of the circle. Burt steps in to block her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She stares at him until he does, then leads the STAR MAN down the path that opens for them in the crowd. They pass a MALL GUARD who has just arrived.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Stop it!!! Stop it!!!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Get away from him!! Leave him alone!! You stupid jerks!! He's retarded!! Can't you see that?!! Get away from him!!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He was stealing my baby...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're wrong!! He would never do anything like that!! (takes STAR MAN's hand) Let's go...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He had Gloria in his hands!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He's retarded! I shouldn't have left him alone!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (hisses) Get out of my way.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Are you okay? Still shaken, the STAR MAN nods. Jenny realizes that it is comforting to him to have his hand in hers and she leads him like a child down the sidewalk to the Mustang.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Mall Guard follows them down the walk-way and watches them drive off. He scribbles the license number in his notebook.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (as Jenny puts him in the passenger seat) Thank you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: At the counter Jenny puts her Visa card back into her wallet while the CLERK staples the pages of a ticket into a travel folder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We FOLLOW Jenny THROUGH the people milling around the benches in the waiting area TO the STAR MAN seated in an open-faced coffee shop. He is watching a MOTHER feed her baby in the booth across from him. A map of the United States is spread out on the formica. Jenny plunks herself down catty-cornered from him. The tear in his sleeve has been closed with safety pins.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The STAR MAN looks at the map. Lathrop Wells is a small town north of Las Vegas on Highway 95. From there he runs his finger to a spot in the Funeral Range of Death Valley.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The STAR MAN nods that he understands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jenny takes a few sweeps at an imaginary highway with her thumb. The stares this pantomime draws make the STAR MAN more nervous about the bus trip than he already is.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The STAR MAN stops.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jenny pushes open a glass door to:
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (handing it to her) Gate three. It's boarding now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thank you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Have a nice trip.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The closest I was able to get you was Lathrop Wells...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (pointing to baby) Is that a baby?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: A baby is a new person?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Eh... yes...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Do you have a baby?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No... The closest...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'd love to have a baby. But I can't...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I can't... Forget the baby. Okay? The closest I was able to get you was Lathrop Wells. You'll have to hitchhike the rest of the way.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But I must go here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I know that. But the buses don't go there.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (suspicious) What is hitchhike?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's easy. I'll explain that in a minute. This is your ticket. When you get on the bus here, the driver will take this part. You will ride to Omaha. When you get to Omaha, ask the driver. 'Salt Lake City, please. I do not speak English.'
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Say it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: 'Salt Lake City, please. I do not speak English.'
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The driver will...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But I speak English.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Will you please do it my way? You'll get into trouble if you don't. If anybody talks to you, tell them... I do not speak English.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (indignant) I do not speak English.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Right. In Omaha the driver will put you on the bus for Salt Lake City and the new driver will take... (bends back second portion of ticket) ...this part. When you get to Salt Lake City, ask the driver, 'Las Vegas, please'...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (impatient) 'Las Vegas, please. I do not speak English.' What is hitchhike?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You want this ticket?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Then don't be smart. P.A. SYSTEM (V.O.) Last call for bus 33 to Vermillion, Sioux City and Omaha... loading at Gate 3.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's your bus. (picks up the map and folds it) When you get to Las Vegas, ask the driver. 'Lathrop Wells, please. I do not speak English.'
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (falling into step next to her) 'Lathrop Wells, please. I do not speak English.'
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (hands him the map) You keep this. Now this is hitch- hike... (stops in the middle of the waiting area to illustrate) You stand on the side of the road, the highway... you understand? And you face the cars going in the direction you want to go. When you see a car or a truck coming, you stick out your thumb like this...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Your thumb tells the driver that you want a ride.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The car will stop?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing toward the loading platform) Not every car, but... a car will stop... Maybe not the first car... maybe number eight, number fifteen...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: When do I get to Lathrop Wells?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Tomorrow morning. Start hitch-hiking right away and...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: ...you'll have plenty of time to get to where you want to go. The STAR MAN hangs back when he sees the security guards.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She maneuvers him into the end of the line.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She takes some of the paper money out of her wallet and stuffs it in his pocket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The line moves forward a step.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He watches her walk away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jenny comes back and takes his hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A family of four climbs aboard and the line moves up. The STAR MAN is alert to everything happening on the platform. Jenny sneaks him an affectionate look. No one in front of him has baggage to check and they move quickly past the DRIVER until the STAR MAN is next in line.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The STAR MAN hands the Driver his ticket. The Driver rips out the first coupon and hands it back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When they stop at the door, she impulsively kisses him on the cheek.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The STAR MAN climbs the steps just ahead of him. The door closes. Its ENGINE REVVING, the bus backs out of its stall. Jenny catches a glimpse of the STAR MAN bent over in the aisle looking out at her. She waves until the bus rounds the building.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Don't worry. They're not going to hurt you. Come on. (gives him ticket) Only show this to the driver. Nobody else. And don't lose it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Can I have the gun?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You might need this.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't be afraid. Do what I told you and you'll be okay.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (nervous) Yes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well... I'm going to go now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Go?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes. I have a long ride ahead of me... (takes his hand) Goodbye.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Goodbye.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Jennyhaydn.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Please stay.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll stay till you get on the bus.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ticket?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: See? You're going to be okay.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Goodbye.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (touches his cheek) What?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's a kiss... (she motions for him to get on the bus) Goodbye...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Let's go.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Jenny's green Mustang loops around the end of a row of cars and heads for the street.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Eyewitnesses are the worst. You get two of them together. You got three stories. You know what I mean?

dialogue.raw_text: Hey, it's none of my business why you're chasing a retard... You want my opinion, it's the girl. She had to hold the guy's hand all the way to the car like he was a kid.

dialogue.raw_text: You saw that?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey... he didn't look like no big time criminal to me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Eh... the store tells you to call when there's trouble, so they won't get sued... But that shouldn't matter if there's a reward, right?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I wouldn't think so.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (peeling off) That's what I thought. So remember it was me because sometimes rewards come late, you know.

dialogue.raw_text: We will. (he turns to Lyman) Something's wrong here. She's helping him now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (alarmed) I know. She bought him a ticket for Lathrop Wells and put him on the bus. He didn't stay on though and they drove off together.

dialogue.raw_text: (shaking his head) Doesn't make sense.

dialogue.raw_text: Maybe he's turned her into one of them. They enter the crowd around the helicopter.

direction.raw_text: The Mustang cruises along between fields of corn.
