dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Why did your ship land on this planet... on Earth?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) It was a mistake.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The following conversation will be played over various views of Americana: a station wagon load of kids, waving and laughing, lovers kissing at a bus stop, billboards, car lots, a dog taking a leak against a tree, cheerleaders practicing on a football field, a funeral cortege, a telephone repairman up on a pole.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pause. Jenny feels the STAR MAN staring at her. She turns to look at him. His gaze doesn't waver. She looks back at the road, then back at the STAR MAN.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You thought we were a different planet?!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No. My ship was doing a map of all the suns and...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Stars... When a sun is far away, we call it a 'star.'
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We were doing a map of the stars and all the other things up there when we saw a small ship. My... eh... we kidnapped it. On it there was a map that said how to come to Earth. This was very important. Before then, we thought we were the only people in all the stars.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You did? That's funny. So did we.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We told our home, and the people who tell us what to do on my planet said to come and look but not to talk, not to land, not to shoot. Just to look from up there. We came and... the driver of my ship...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The captain...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The captain wanted to land to see close and to get some things from Earth to take home. The police came and shot at us. One of the people from my ship was killed.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, that's terrible. I'm sorry. Was he a good friend?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't understand 'friend.'
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: A friend is a person that is good to you... someone you like to be with... someone you like to laugh with...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He was a good friend... The captain took the ship away fast and I was not in the ship.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The police shouldn't have started shooting. But you can hardly blame them. You surprised them. They didn't know you were up there. When they saw you, they thought you were here to hurt us.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I understand.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sounds like your captain's going to get hell when he gets back home.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What is hell?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's bad.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He will.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What are you doing?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Are you my friend?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (smiles) I am your friend.
dialogue.name: dialogue

result.heading: HEAR A JUMBLE OF RADIO STATIONS

direction.raw_text: Jenny's Mustang is whipping west out of Lincoln, Nebraska. We HEAR A JUMBLE OF RADIO STATIONS as the SELECTOR is RUN THROUGH THE FREQUENCIES.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jenny is driving. The STAR MAN finds a RELIGIOUS STATION ON the RADIO.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jenny is tired. She doesn't want to get into that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The STAR MAN lets it drop and finds a COUNTRY AND WESTERN STATION.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jenny smiles at him, then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She TURNS OFF the RADIO.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He turns away from her, clears his throat and begins. His singing is like nothing we have ever heard. Vibrations of tones and glottal stops blend into a haunting, seductive fugue. The STAR MAN stops.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) (on radio) God is your creator. God is your master. God is you savior. God is the only reason that you exist. If God...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (during the above) Who is God?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Nobody knows.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't know.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I like this music.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I've noticed... Do you understand what they're saying?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not all... but it feels like a kiss.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Do you have music up there?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'd like to hear it. Can you sing something?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I do not want to.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't be afraid... I'd really like to hear it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Please.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I am not a good singer.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That was beautiful.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (incredulous) You liked my singing?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes. Sing some more.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: With the STAR MAN's SERENADE WAFTING over the Nebraska plains, we FALL BACK TO FIND a Highway Patrol car tagging along at a safe distance behind the Mustang.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The STAR MAN stops the Mustang in front of the office. He and Jenny get out and go inside. As the door closes on them, three Nebraska Highway Patrol cars speed up the off-ramp. The lead car turns right on a surface street and enters the motel parking lot at the far end. The middle car goes straight across the intersection and positions itself at the curb next to the driveway, giving access to a frontage road which leads to an on-ramp. The last car also turns right on the surface street, but parks in a restaurant parking lot directly across from the office.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In answer to Jenny's bell, the night CLERK comes out of the living quarters in the back, finger combing his sleep-rumpled hair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Drawn by the bright colors on their covers, the STAR MAN wanders over to the magazine rack. By chance, he selects a copy of 'Playgirl' and begins to look through it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: From behind the STAR MAN, we WATCH Jenny react to the open Playgirl centerfold that he is holding up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Although we cannot see it, we know what he is pointing at.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The STAR MAN swivels the picture around so that he can see it. Jenny hands the smirking Clerk her credit card. He steps to the side and inserts it into the imprinter. Out of the corner of his eye, he sees a dot of light leave the STAR MAN's forehead to drop behind the magazine and into his trousers. The Clerk glances over at Jenny to see if she hears the HISSING that is going on behind the STAR MAN's fly. She does and she hopes it'll stop soon. His eyes on the STAR MAN, the Clerk fumbles the key to 117 off the rack.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He drops the key on the counter.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What can I do for you folks?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How much are your rooms?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thirty-seven fifty for one person, forty-nine fifty for two.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You have one with two beds?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sure.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll take that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (slides her a registration card) Fill this out. (as Jenny writes) Will this be cash or credit card?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Credit card.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll have to run your card off now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (digging through her purse) We're only going to be here a few hours...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's still the full price.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Jenny, look...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Put that back.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But I have never seen this before. I am not complete.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Put it back.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You can park your car in front of the room.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Through his side window, the DRIVER can see the motel office.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (into microphone of his radio) What did these two do?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: All anybody knows is that they're armed and dangerous. In the office, he can see Jenny and the STAR MAN leave the counter and head for the door. He raises a pair of binoculars to his eyes for a good head-on look at them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We SEE Jenny and the STAR MAN come out of the motel office.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Second Officer lowers the glasses and looks down at the telex pictures of Jenny and the STAR MAN taped to the dashboard.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Be a piece of cake for us to take 'em.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: the WINDSHIELD, we can SEE Jenny and the STAR MAN approaching the Mustang.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: National Security folks should be here any minute. Let them take care of it. That's what they get the big bucks for.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: I want a drink. May I have two quarters? At the passenger door, Jenny sets her purse on the car roof to take out her wallet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Over her purse she notices the patrol car facing her from the restaurant parking lot. There is certainly nothing unusual about a patrol car in a restaurant parking lot. She shrugs it off and gets in the Mustang.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (handing it to him) You shouldn't drink so much of that stuff. It's bad for you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: On the radio they say it's good.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hurry up.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Jenny's behind hasn't even hit the seat before she sees the patrol car parked on the frontage road off to her left. She looks at the STAR MAN. He's busy pounding on the drink machine. She turns around to check the lot behind her and spots the patrol car there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The STAR MAN stiffens when he sees the patrol car on the frontage road.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (coming to the car with a drink can in each hand) The machine gave me two. Should I put one back?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No. Get in.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (rounding the hood) You can have one.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (as he gets in) I'm not sleepy anymore. Let's drive for a little while longer.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Are you angry at me?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No. I'm just not tired. Let's go.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The Mustang moves toward the frontage road.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (as the Mustang rolls onto the frontage road) They made us. Let's get 'em.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All three patrol cars jam on their rack lights and, with their SIRENS HOWLING, peel out after Jenny and the STAR MAN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: At the SOUND, the STAR MAN snaps his attention to the rear view mirror. It's ablaze with police lights. He tromps on the gas.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: No.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Shermin is patched into the Nebraska Highway Patrol and is listening to the pursuit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Mustang careens down the on-ramp and squeezes into the traffic a hair's breath ahead of an 18-wheeler. This cuts off the patrol cars momentarily, but the Mustang doesn't have the speed to stay ahead of them. Using the other cars on the road as shields, the STAR MAN dodges from lane to lane trying to keep the police from coming alongside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The lead patrol car feints forward on the STAR MAN's side. The STAR MAN sways over to cut it off and the middle patrol car slips in next to Jenny. The STAR MAN grabs the gun from under the seat.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: No!!! No!!!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: He's got a gun!!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jenny screams. A shotgun blast from the middle patrol car rips through the door and into Jenny. Part of the FRONT WINDOW is BLOWN OUT. Bleeding badly, she slumps against the STAR MAN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Her eyelids flutter open and she tries to speak, but can't. The middle patrol car is lining up for another shot. The STAR MAN slams the Mustang into it, sending it spinning onto the shoulder and into a ditch. The last patrol car speeds up to replace it. The lead patrol car slips in next to the STAR MAN. They've got him in a sandwich. The STAR MAN stands on his brakes.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Jennyhaydn! Jennyhaydn!!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Caught by surprise, the patrol cars rocket ahead of him. The Mustang cuts across the swatch of land that acts as a center divider in the highway and races west in the eastbound lanes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The STAR MAN squints against the headlights of the on-coming traffic as he calmly wedges his way straight through it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The lead patrol car tries to follow him but is clipped by a Cadillac swerving to avoid the STAR MAN and bounced back into the center divider. The last patrol car parallels the Mustang in the westbound lanes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The STAR MAN realizes he's still boxed in. A car carrier swerves by on his left. The lane behind is open. The STAR MAN takes advantage of the opportunity.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Mustang vaults off the shoulder of the highway into an open field and bullets away through the weeds. The rush of oncoming traffic traps the three patrol cars in the center divider.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jenny moans as the car jostles over the rough ground. The STAR MAN puts out a hand to cushion her ride. His headlights pick up a gravel road splitting the field and he turns onto it. In a quick look back, he sees the patrol car shooting across the highway after him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We FOLLOW the Mustang as it winds upward through the grazing lands sparsely dotted with clumps of trees. The plume of dust kicked up by the fleeing car is turned silver by a full moon. The WAIL OF the PATROL CARS is DISTANT BUT CLOSING.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Mustang barrels around a curve and slides to a surprise stop before a gate in a barbed wire fence that ends the road. With the .45 in his hand, the STAR MAN jumps out of the car and tries the gate. It is locked. When he turns back to the car, he sees something that frightens him more than the approaching patrol cars. A helicopter has joined the chase. He looks for a place to hide. A stand of cottonwood and elm fifty yards on the other side of the gate offers the only protection. The STAR MAN opens the passenger door. Jenny is soaked in her own blood. He hooks the strap of her purse over his shoulder, lifts her tenderly and, cradling her in his arms, wiggles between a fence post and the gate and jogs into the trees.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The helicopter sets down behind the Mustang. Shermin leads Bell, Lyman and the technicians to the car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shermin pushes the seat forward. The STAR MAN's life-support suit is stuffed in the space behind it. The patrol cars skid around the curve.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shermin takes a bullhorn from Lyman and goes around to the front of the Mustang. The highway patrolmen get out of their cars behind him.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (seeing the blood on the passenger seat) One of them must be pretty badly hurt.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Bell, indicating the suit) Get this back to the copter.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (bullhorn to woods) Mrs. Haydn, please come out. We don't want to hurt you or your friend. Please put down your weapon and come out.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Jenny's limp weight is beginning to slow the STAR MAN. He hears the bullhorn but doesn't stop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shermin lowers the bullhorn and speaks to the patrolmen.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Okay, fan out. These people have a gun but we want them alive. Understand?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: A deep shadow on the other side of an elm offers a likely hiding place. He moves through the underbrush toward it. Without warning, his feet begin to slip out from under him. He struggles to regain his balance. When he does he looks down to find himself staring at a RAGING RIVER 150 feet below. The bank on the other side is just a few feet above the water and in the moonlight he can see a flat plain cut by a highway that stretches into the distance. Slowly, he backs away from the edge of the cliff. From under the elm he watches the helicopter sweep out over the ravine. Its searchlight darts toward him bleaching the treeline. The overhanging branches cloak him and Jenny and the light passes without picking them up. The STAR MAN adjusts his grip on Jenny and starts off in the opposite direction from the helicopter to look for a way down the cliff.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shermin, his people and the patrolmen are combing the woods with flashlights in a picketline search. The Third Driver stops at the mouth of a clearing that runs between the cottonwood and elm to the cliff. He takes a bite off a block of chewing tobacco. As he replaces it in his pocket, he sees a shadow flit across the far end of the clearing. He swings his flashlight in that direction. The beam catches a piece of Jenny and the STAR MAN.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Over here! They're over here!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Standing on the rim of the gorge, the STAR MAN sees the rays of his pursuers' flashlights choking off any possible escape. He eases Jenny to the ground behind a boulder. She whimpers with the pain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He stretches over the top of the boulder and scatters FOUR SHOTS at the lights.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (strokes her cheek) You will be all right.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The patrolmen, the technicians and Shermin all hit the ground and kill their lights.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Mrs. Haydn, we don't want to hurt you. Put down your gun and come out. We just want to talk to your friend.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The STAR MAN peers around the boulder. At that instant the searchlight from the helicopter happens to splash across the men in the field. He sees that their guns are drawn and pointed in his direction. The STAR MAN pulls back and takes a marble from his pouch. It grows and glows gold as the STAR MAN rolls it between his palms. When it reaches the size of a baseball, he clutches it firmly in his right hand and EMPTIES the .45 toward Shermin and the police. This time, there is a BARRAGE OF ANSWERING FIRE. With the BULLETS RICOCHETING around him, the STAR MAN lifts Jenny to his shoulder. He massages the golden orb until it becomes the size of a soccer ball, then takes two quick steps to the edge of the cliff and leaps into the abyss.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The upward thrust of the ball supports their fall and under its glow they begin a slow descent to the other side of the river. Above them, the helicopter dips back and locks its searchlight on the shelf of boulders they just left.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The STAR MAN sets down with the smoothness of a man stepping off an escalator. He looks over his shoulder. The helicopter is still concentrating its spotlight on the ridge. He speaks to the ball in his language.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He lets the ball go and, with even more velocity than the others, it zips into the sky.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (subtitles) Iron channel message. Almost caught by pursuers. This may hinder escape. Wait for me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: in a Frederick's of Hollywood negligee lets a TRUCK DRIVER out of one of the Winnebagos parked to the side of the main building.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Her rusty laugh follows him into the parking lot. He walks between the trucks to a semi which has half of a pre-fab mobile home tied onto its flat-bed. The polyethylene that covers the open side of the house flaps in the WIND at the lower corner next to the cab. The Driver opens his door. He takes out a staple gun and refastens the dark green plastic to the house frame.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Don't forget to tell the boys where you had a good time.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (calling back to her) You weren't that good.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: In the middle of the empty bedroom, the STAR MAN tries to cushion Jenny against the sudden JOLTS made by the semi as it lumbers out of the parking lot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: With the Driver taking it smoothly through the gears, the semi picks up speed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The STAR MAN moves Jenny into a rectangle of moonlight shaped on the floor by a high, wide window and strips off her blouse. The cold light marbles Jenny's skin and makes the blood from her wounds appear black. With her blouse, the STAR MAN wipes away the blood on the right side of her head and neck. He finds a deep glass cut on her cheek and two entry points in her neck. He concentrates on her cheek and we can SEE the glow of his brain through his human skin. A bit of the white light comes out of his forehead. It tumbles across to Jenny's cheek and settles into the wound. The STAR MAN watches intently as one end of the wound flares brightly for an instant, then dies. The flesh left behind has been closed without a scar. A larger piece of light drops out of his forehead into what's left of the gash. With that area suffused in a healing glow, he shifts his focus to the pellet holes on her neck. He sends two pieces of light plunging into the wounds. Immediately, they spread into halos which we can SEE radiating from under the skin. Out of the night comes a LONG BLAST ON the AIR HORN and the STAR MAN has to steady Jenny as the truck swerves around something in the highway. When it settles back into its ride, the STAR MAN wipes the blood off Jenny's shoulder. The beams of the passing cars through the plastic catch the fatigue on the STAR MAN's face as he works over Jenny.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: With its pre-fab house, the semi rumbles through Julesburg, Sterling and Ft. Morgan. By the time it gets to Denver, dawn is beginning to color the tips of the Rocky Mountains.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's still dark in here. With a chunk of light in his left hand, the STAR MAN dabs at the last of Jenny's wounds, leaving behind a phosphorescent bandage. More of these patches glimmer up and down her right side. He checks her over to see if he's missed a wound. He hasn't. He covers her with his windbreaker and, exhausted by his efforts, sits back against the wall. He waits to see that Jenny is sleeping comfortably, then presses the palms of his hands together. The satel compass appears between them. The green dot tells him he is still on course.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Colorado Highway PATROLMEN are dropping orange fluorescent cones across two of the three westbound lanes to form a roadblock. The sound of a harmonica draws us to Shermin's helicopter parked in a meadow beside the road.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As the radio technician plays the harmonica, Lyman clangs down the steps and bends to wake Shermin who is sacked out under the fuselage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shermin sighs and rolls over on his back. He looks terrible.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Tell him I'm not here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I did.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Get me a radio. At least I won't have to look at his face.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Shermin is holding a field radio to his ear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stung, Shermin takes a deep breath, controls himself and returns the radio to his ear.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) We're growing very concerned back here. There's no use pretending otherwise. We're rapidly approaching a 'condition red.' People are beginning to ask difficult questions.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll make this as simple as I can, George. They disappeared.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) I don't care where you're from you just can't disappear into thin air.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (through a punchy hysterical laugh) George, listen to what you're saying. This thing's changed itself into a man. Disappearing may not be that big a deal.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) So far you've let it cross the heart of America. For two days it has been absorbing information that is detrimental to our security. I don't see the humor in that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Maybe... look, this is just something to think about... from what I got at the shopping center, it was more scared than anything else... I don't feel it's as big a threat as you think it is...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Is that what's affecting your performance?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm not being unpatriotic, and I'm doing my damndest to catch them. Bell's up on 80 and I'm down here on 70 past Grand Junction. They're heading west. If they're not flying we have a damn good chance of getting them. All I'm asking is that you people think about it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) You just do your job, Shermin. We'll make the policy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The semi is in the slow lane. Its right rear turn signal blinks steadily telling US that it is leaving the highway and going north at the intersection ahead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jenny stirs awake under the windbreaker in the bedroom as a sloppy DOWNSHIFT JOLTS the house. Her eyes flutter open and she looks around the room trying to figure out where she is. The truck leans into the turn. Jenny braces herself on one arm and sits up. Catching the windbreaker as it slips off her front, she remembers that she was shot and examines her right side. She runs her fingers over her cheek and neck, across her shoulder and down her side, feeling for traces of the wounds she knows she sustained. She has been completely healed and there are no scars. She leans forward and looks down the hallway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The WIND snapping the polyethylene is the only answer she gets. She picks her blouse off the floor next to her purse, but throws it aside and shrugs into the windbreaker when she sees the blood and bullet holes. Her sudden rise to a standing position makes her light-headed and she has to lean against the doorway until the spinning stops. With her hands outstretched, as guards against the sway of the truck, Jenny shuffles down the hallway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There is no one in the kitchen and she continues into the living room. It is empty. Jenny opens the door to an enclosed back porch. It is also empty. The STAR MAN is gone. She returns to the living room and stands there not really knowing what to do next. The countryside rushes by outside a floor- to-ceiling picture window.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Hello... hello.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hello. Where are you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: the semi's AIR HORN jars Jenny out of her reverie and she goes to press her cheek against the window. She is looking past her left hand at the road when she notices a wide green ring on her finger above her wedding band. She steps back from the window to examine it, then with some trepidation, twists it off. As it clears the end of her finger, the STAR MAN's VOICE SPEAKS OUT OF IT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jenny drops the ring as if she'd been stung. The STAR MAN's voice stops as soon as she does and the ring bounces across the floor until it hits the baseboard. It looks innocent enough lying there, but Jenny has a great deal of trouble making herself approach it. When she finally picks it up, it does nothing. She turns it in her hand and when the side of the ring hole that was facing her when she took the ring off faces her again, the STAR MAN's VOICE CONTINUES.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Jennyhay...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) ...nd. You are all fixed. I'm sorry you were shot. I was a big problem for you. Thank you for your help. I can go to my ship alone now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The semi is picking up speed as it heads north.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Driver checks his side view mirror to see if the lane next to him is clear and is astonished to see a woman's arm sticking out of the polyethylene waving a blouse at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Smoke billows from under the tires as the semi skids to a stop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jenny, her purse over her shoulder, is running toward the cab as the Driver steps out with a wrench in his hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jenny's thumb is already out for a ride as she sprints across the highway.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Where did you stop last?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What the hell do you think you're doing?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Where did you stop last?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Stay right there...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What was your last stop?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Elmo's...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Where's that?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: About five miles back.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (shouting after her) Are there any more in there?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: A passing car TAKES US TO the STAR MAN as he runs along the shoulder to a maroon and white '57 Chevy that has pulled off to pick him up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A swarthy, bald MAN with hairy arms leans across the seat.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Where are you going?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Las Vegas, please. I do not speak English.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hop in.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: (re-entering the flow of traffic) I can only take you to Grand Junction, but you'll have a better chance to get a ride from there. The STAR MAN smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The STAR MAN starts to point to the sky, then catches himself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: These are foreign words to the STAR MAN and he pastes on his smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He sticks a cigarette in his mouth and flips one up for the STAR MAN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The STAR MAN takes it, quickly examines it, then positions it in his mouth at the exact angle the Cook did. His eyebrows raise when the Cook flicks his Bic and puffs an ash on the end of his cigarette. The butane flame is swung in his direction and he flinches back before allowing the Cook to singe his Camel. He copies the Cook's puffing and the end of his cigarette begins to glow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Cook inhales deeply from his cigarette and blows smoke at the windshield. The STAR MAN mimics the inhalation, then chokes. His eyes bulge and his cheeks puff out as he tries to be cool and not cough. The Cook takes no notice of his struggles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Smoke starts to dribble out of the Star Man's nose and mouth. Puzzled, he re-examines his cigarette.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Cook takes another drag. As if etiquette required it, the STAR MAN hurries to copy him. This time there are no ill effects.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Cook flicks his ash out of the window. A moment later, the STAR MAN mirrors his action.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Where you from?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't understand.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Parlez vous Francais?... Habla Ingles?... Sprechen zie deutsch?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Good job, neither do I. What do you do for a living?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (pretending) I don't understand.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm a cook. Do you understand 'cook?'
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Food. Eat. I prepare food. I work as a cook. That's how I make money.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I understand.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What do you do?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (searches for an answer, then) I make maps.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey, that sounds interesting. You like it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Eh... yes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Make any money?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (takes a pack of Camels out of his pocket) You don't get rich as a cook, either, believe me. I got a girl going to college this fall. The wife had to go back to nursing to help pay for it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Smoke?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: She wants to become a doctor. She's a bright kid. Hard worker. I think she'll make it. But the damned inflation's driven the tuition up so high it makes it real tough on a family like ours.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I got two other kids. I don't know what we'll do when they get old enough for college.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Everybody blames it on the oil crisis. That might be where it starts. But I think a lot of people are just using that as an excuse to rip the rest of us off. I see it every day in the kitchen. Peaches. We use the gallon cans. The price has gone up three times in the last year. And now the cans are only half full.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Do you have children?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They're damned expensive and a pain in the ass sometimes, but I wouldn't trade having them for anything.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What do you think of America?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It is beautiful.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: A truck stop set back as little as the law allows from the BUZZ OF INTERSTATE 70.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We FIND Jenny at the set of fuel pumps nearest the highway dogging an ATTENDANT while he services an 18-wheeler
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jenny folds back the plastic windows to the picture of her husband.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We FOLLOW Jenny as she wends her way through the trucks questioning other attendants. The RUMBLE OF TRAFFIC DROWNS OUT their CONVERSATION, but the answer is always the same. Finally, we FOLLOW the picture as Jenny hands it up to an ATTENDANT cleaning the windshield on a Peterbilt cab.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He hands the snapshot back to Jenny. She nods a 'thank you' and looks wistfully around the yard. There is nothing she can do. Fitting the picture back into her wallet, she walks away. After a few steps she turns back.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) I'm looking for a guy about this tall, with brown hair and really gray eyes...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He had on tan cords, a plaid shirt and a baseball cap... probably hitchhiking.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't pay much attention to those guys.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (taking out her wallet) In the last hour or so...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Nope.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This is him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (shakes his head) Sorry.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (looking at picture) I don't know... I'm not sure. I might have seen him up the road a piece on my way in. He's long gone by now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You know if anybody here's going to Wisconsin?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ask inside.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: It's bustling, loud and smoky. Jenny is standing just inside the entrance. She licks her lips and tries to clear the frog out of her throat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nobody pays any attention to her. Her voice trails off. She swallows hard and tries again, this time booming out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The activity in the diner comes to a screeching halt and in the silence Jenny adds in a normal voice:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: An OLDER MAN, with a face seamed by cigarettes and weather, waves at her from the counter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This gets some good-humored cheers and catcalls.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Smiling self-consciously, she takes a seat at the end of the counter and orders coffee from the waitress. While she is waiting for it to come, she happens to glance outside and sees a Colorado Highway patrol car stopped in the yard. The officer on the passenger side is talking to one of the attendants. Jenny turns away from the window and finds that she is able to watch the conversation in a strip of mirrors that runs around the top of the pie case. The squad car leaves and her coffee arrives.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (small voice) Anybody going to...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Anybody going to Wisconsin?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I need a ride.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm going to Des Moines. If you can wait till I finish here, you're welcome to ride along.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I can wait.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to the waitress) Where's the phone?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Jenny drops a dime in the slot and dials 'O.'
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: After TWO RINGS, the phone is picked up on the other end of the line.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Operator... may I help you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Could you give me the highway patrol, please?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Sergeant Packert, Highway Patrol.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: My name's Jenny Haydn. I think you're looking for me. I was kidnapped in Eau Claire, Wisconsin a couple of days ago. But I'm free now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) What was your name again?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Jenny Haydn. I'm on my way home and I don't want anybody I'm with shot at when you...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Hold on.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Standing back of the officers, Shermin watches them check to cars passing through the squeeze point. Every car trunk is opened. Vans and campers are looked into. Lyman runs up and whispers in Shermin's ear. Shermin is startled by what he hears. He leaves Lyman in charge and hurries to the helicopter parked in the field beside the roadblock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: gives Shermin a headset phone as he enters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shermin puts on the headset and the technician starts a tape recorder.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (hand over the mouth- piece) You trace it yet?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: All we know right now is that it's east of here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This is Marc Shermin. Where are you, Mrs. Haydn?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: I don't know. Someplace called Elmo's. Look, I just wanted to tell you that I'm all right and I'm on my way home.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) You've been through quite an ordeal, Mrs. Haydn. Why don't you stay where you are and let us pick you up? We'll fly you home.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No. You'll want to ask a lot of questions I don't want to answer right now. I already have a ride.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The Technician hands Shermin a note which reads: ELMO"S TRUCK STOP/ABOUT 30 MILES EAST.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shermin jabs his thumb upward, indicating that the helicopter should lift off.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) I only called to tell you I was free and not to shoot anybody I was with if you see me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Is the man who kidnapped you there now?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) I told you. He let me go. I'm on my way home.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (his hand over the mouthpiece) Get a highway patrol unit over there.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Shermin's helicopter lifts off.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Mrs. Haydn, I'm going to have to ask you to stay where you are.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: A sharp rap on the glass startles Jenny and she turns around to see her ride.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jenny holds up a finger that asks for a moment longer on the phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This hits Jenny like a kick in the stomach. She leans her head back against the wall. Her ride is pacing outside the booth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jenny smashes the receiver back in its cradle and throws open the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She rushes down the hallway to the dining area where again she stands just inside the entrance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The place goes quiet except for a smattering of laughter.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Ready?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (into phone) Mr... I'm sorry, what was your name again?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Marc Shermin.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Mr. Shermin, I'm hanging up now. If you want to ask me any questions, call me at home in a couple of days. I'm in the book.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Do you know what you were kidnapped by?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Mrs. Haydn...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He doesn't want to hurt anybody. Please leave him alone.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Is he on his way to Lathrop Wells?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) What's he planning to do in Lathrop Wells? Is he meeting someone there?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (on her way past the weathered driver) I changed my mind. Thanks.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (at the top of her lungs) It's me again...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I need a fast ride west.
dialogue.name: dialogue

result.heading: COMPETES WITH ROCK N' ROLL ON THE TAPE DECK

direction.raw_text: The speedometer reads 90. The driver, a bespectacled, pimply- faced SIXTEEN YEAR OLD, shifts into fifth gear. Jenny is harnessed in the passenger seat. Chatter from a CB under the dash COMPETES WITH ROCK N' ROLL ON THE TAPE DECK.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But he downshifts. The Porsche is going a mere 80 when they pass the station wagon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Howling at full throttle, three highway patrol cars rush past them in the opposite direction. Jenny swivels around to follow their progress until they are out of sight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jenny takes a second look at this guy. He flashes her a gap- toothed grin.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You sure this is your car?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (with a stutter) My grandmother's rich.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (as they come up on a station wagon) Slow down, slow down.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Geez, Mrs. Haydn, we just got going.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (peering at its occupants) I told you I'm looking for someone.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: In the cars, too?!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't know where he is.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This is going to be a real drag. I thought you wanted to go fast.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They after you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What? No, of course not.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (his stutter thicker than before) Would be kinda neat if they were. I think I could outrun them. Maybe get my picture in the papers.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The Cook's '57 Chevy makes a left on the street intersecting the off-ramp and stops at the curb. Behind it a large plastic yellow chicken twirls on a pole above the restaurant it advertises.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As an afterthought, the STAR MAN duplicates the Cook's wave, then heads down the ramp. As he clears the frame, our VIEW ZOOMS AND ZOOMS AND ZOOMS UNTIL we can SEE a piece of the roadblock in the valley below him. During the MOVE-IN, we BEGIN TO PICK UP CB CHATTER.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Well, here we are... You go down that ramp there, you're sure to get a ride.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (getting out) Thank you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

result.heading: BEGIN TO PICK UP CB CHATTER

dialogue.raw_text: And don't be shy about your English. You speak better than a lot of people I know. (leaving) Take care of yourself.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Flash for all you good buddies heading west on 70. Smoky's got a roadblock just beyond Grand Junction... Better dump your dope, they're going through everything... He's right. I was just there and I'm still sore...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Jenny TURNS DOWN the ROCK 'N ROLL to listen to the CB.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jenny doesn't answer immediately. She takes her time checking out the people in a VW they are passing.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Ah loves to be frisked! What are they looking for? I'm holding. Any way around it? Where are you? Oh no!! There it is!!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I bet you we find your friend at the roadblock.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to the road ahead) We better find him before that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: In the style prescribed by Jenny, the STAR MAN raises his thumb to a dilapidated Vega shimmying down the on-ramp. The two blue-haired ladies inside are afraid to look at him as they go by. He has the same luck with an attractive blonde secretary that passes on the highway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A highway PATROLMAN is standing behind the open door of his car speaking into the mike of his radio.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: The girl's not here, Mr. Shermin. Seems right after she talked to you, she got a ride west with a kid.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: All six TV screens display the road rushing under it.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (into mouthpiece of his headset) You get that, Lyman?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) We're ready.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Shermin's S65 banks through a U-turn and chases west.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A dun-colored Roadrunner gurgles down the ramp and stops in front of the STAR MAN. Two grubby LONG HAIRS in worn western clothes are inside with boxes of house-hold utensils and duffle bags.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He looks at his buddy stretched on the jumble in the back. The buddy nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The STAR MAN opens the door and gets in.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Where you going?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Las Vegas, please.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We're going to L.A.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sure. Get in. We can drop you in Vegas or get you darn close.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The CB CONTINUES TO CRACKLE with news of the roadblock. Jenny's eyes restlessly search the overpass under the whirling yellow chicken for any sign of the STAR MAN. She sees the dun-colored Roadrunner waiting at the foot of the on-ramp for a break in the traffic, but she is too far away to see who's inside. As the Porsche gets closer, it overtakes an 18- wheeler and Jenny's view of the Roadrunner is cut off entirely. She passes without seeing the STAR MAN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Porsche weaves through the traffic giving Jenny a chance to look into the cars and trucks it shoots by.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jenny is turned around looking back at a camper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jenny gives him a withering look.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I'm telling you, you're going to find him at the roadblock, or right after, or not at all.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If he didn't want to go through the roadblock, is there any other way to get to Vegas?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Fly.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The five-fifty. We already passed it. But it'll take him way out of his way.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Pull over. I've got to get back there.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why wouldn't he want to go through the roadblock?... What did you guys do?... I won't tell anybody.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's easier not to tell if you don't know.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The Porsche slows to a stop on the shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She leans back and gives the startled Teenager a kiss on the mouth, then gets out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She closes the door. The Teenager takes a last look at her before pulling back on the highway. Jenny waits for a car in the slow lane to go by, then runs across to the line and waits for cars in the fast lane to go by.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (as Jenny opens the door) Wait. Could I have your autograph?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sure.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I have nothing to do. I'd like to help you.

direction.raw_text: The STAR MAN spots Jenny standing on the line peering into the on-coming cars for signs of him. He becomes agitated and his mouth begins to move soundlessly. There is a break in the traffic and Jenny dashes to the center divider. The STAR MAN leans across his driver and yells as the Roadrunner plunges by her.

direction.raw_text: Jenny spins around to see the Roadrunner skid to a stop on the shoulder and the STAR MAN get out. A motorcycle bombs by. He starts across the lanes of traffic toward Jenny. A truck blasts past him in the slow lane. He is buffeted into the fast lane. Jenny runs down the center divider to meet him. A VW honks, its tires squeal on the pavement as it swerves around him. He reaches the safety of the center divider. Jenny throws her arms around him and lays her head against his chest. He stands there uncomfortably not knowing how to respond to this human emotion.

direction.raw_text: She grabs his wrist but he hangs back.

They lower the blanket from their faces. Jenny lays her head back against the cab, exhausted.

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) All the roads into Death Valley are blocked. We'd like to talk to you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) If I talk to you, I will miss my ship.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Hold on a minute... Let's take the chance, George.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No deal.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . CLOSED GAS STATION - NIGHT SHERMIN (V.O.) I'm afraid we can't let you go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He hangs up.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I understand.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The STAR MAN shaves the rubber off the electrical lines leading into the fuse box and clips two wires of his own onto the exposed copper. With Jenny watching we have a montage of the STAR MAN working through the night: modifying the insides of the Black and Decker drill, cutting out the mid- section above the trigger, fitting electrical components into that area, screwing a pipe into the bit-clamp, welding it together with the spark that arcs between the electrical wires.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jenny folds a sheaf of money into a sheet of yellow paper and props it on the cash register. 'For Damages. Thank You' is scribbled on the front. She runs out to catch the STAR MAN who is on his way to the Camaro.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carrying the modified Black and Decker drill the STAR MAN opens the driver's door.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Where do you think you're going?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thank you, Jennyhaydn. You are good. I must go alone now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I said I would get you to your ship and that's where we're going to say goodbye.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Both hands on the wheel, Jenny is burning down the center line. The STAR MAN bends two thin wires trailing out from the grip of the drill. Jenny winces as he buries them into the flesh on either side of his left wrist. The car skates around the corner of a low hill. They can see that the Cobra is still sitting next to the road.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The STAR MAN is lost in concentration. Jenny kills her lights and glues the accelerator to the floor. Three MEN scramble from the helicopter with M16s. A BURST OF SLUGS RIPS THROUGH the Camaro's WINDSHIELD. The STAR MAN leans out the passenger window and with an other-worldly scream, fires. The helicopter is BLOWN TO SMITHEREENS. The concussion throws the men to the ground.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: A BURST OF SLUGS RIPS THROUGH

dialogue.raw_text: (glancing at the modified drill) I hope that works.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The Camaro whizzes through the falling DEBRIS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It works. The STAR MAN slumps in exhaustion and pain.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I do not know how many times I can do this.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: It is filled with the radio voices of the Cobra crews setting up to attack the Camaro.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Camaro becomes airborne at the crest of a dip. Only its new shocks save the landing.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: REPEATED ON THE OTHER SIDE OF THE CAR

direction.raw_text: The STAR MAN draws the satel compass out between his palms. The green dot now covers the right half of the red dot. He presses his palms together and looks past Jenny at the rugged foothills. The first light of day is starting to color the sky behind them. Jenny and the STAR MAN are startled by the DRUMMING WHOMP OF A HELICOPTER. The STAR MAN looks out the window for its source. He can't see anything. The SOUND FADES. In a moment, it is REPEATED ON THE OTHER SIDE OF THE CAR and AGAIN IT FADES.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is a truism that Jenny doesn't want to hear and she flexes her fingers on the wheel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jenny and the STAR MAN steady themselves for the last leg of their journey. Suddenly, their silence is exploded by a COBRA dropping out of the sky in front of them. Its searchlight bangs into their faces and, with its thirty-calibre MACHINE GUNS BLAZING, it comes straight at them. Jenny yanks the Camaro onto the shoulder. The SLUGS CHEW UP the asphalt beside it. She fishtails back onto the road. A SECOND COBRA surprises them from the STAR MAN's side. Its MACHINE GUN KNOCKS OUT the BACK WINDOW before he can FIRE. The STAR MAN crawls over his seat and arranges himself in the hole that was the back window to meet the Cobras' next FIRING RUN. It doesn't take them long. The first two have been joined by a THIRD. They swoop down on the Camaro.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: If my ship is not here, we are in trouble.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (points at a distinctive cone peak) That's where we landed last time. Right under that mountain.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The gunsights lock on the car below. The CO-PILOT squeezes the trigger.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: STAR MAN BLOWS THEM OUT OF THE SKY

direction.raw_text: S THUMP INTO the trunk in front of the STAR MAN and he FIRES. The lead HELICOPTER ERUPTS, raining pieces of hot metal over the desert floor. The other helicopters are jarred out of their run and their BULLETS harmlessly KICK UP SAND on the shoulder. Before they can regroup, the STAR MAN BLOWS THEM OUT OF THE SKY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The STAR MAN has to hang on as Jenny dodges the car out of the path of a Cobra skimming over the highway toward them. As it goes over, he is able to get off a SHOT directly INTO its UNDERBELLY. The BALL OF FLAME almost engulfs the Camaro.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: In front!!! In front!!!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The STAR MAN slumps down into the back seat breathing hard. Jenny looks over her shoulder at him and is shocked at the strain that shows on his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She throws the car into a skid and leaves the blacktop for a dirt road winding between two low hills.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Hang on.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: At the base of a sandstone cliff, the Camaro slides to a stop. Jenny helps the STAR MAN out. She supports him as they struggle toward the protection of the boulders. Fox's Cobra roars over the hill.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (spots the car) Over there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The STAR MAN turns toward the Cobra. Weakly, he raises his weapon and pulls the trigger. Nothing happens. The searchlight from the Cobra finds them. Its machine guns begin to raise puffs of gravel around them. Jenny grabs the STAR MAN's arm and pulls him into the relative safety of the rocks. The STAR MAN collapses against the cool stone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jenny looks out between the crags. Shermin's helicopter arrives to join the Cobra. With their searchlights flicking over the sagebrush, they move cautiously toward the cliff. Jenny turns back to the STAR MAN. He is too weak to run anymore.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (gasps) I can't shoot anymore.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (touches his shoulder lightly) I won't let anyone hurt you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Watch it. They're coming out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Six images (close-up to full shot) of Jenny and the STAR MAN stepping out of their hiding place fill the television screens in front of Shermin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lyman taps his keyboard. The screens all change to a long- shot of Jenny and the STAR MAN with cross-hairs superimposed on them.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) End it, Shermin.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Shermin's helicopter moves toward Jenny and the STAR MAN standing helpless in the circle thrown by the searchlight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The cross-hairs have locked on Jenny and the STAR MAN. Shermin knows he can't do it. He picks up a headset.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shermin flips a switch on the console that cuts Fox off.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: George... Do you hear me, George?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) What?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I just retired.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Shermin!! Shermin!!!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to his crew) Let's get out of here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Shermin's helicopter passes over the heads of Jenny and the STAR MAN and rises into the dawn sky.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shermin!!! He throws down his headset.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The gunsights lock in on Jenny and the STAR MAN. Fox's grip tightens on the trigger. Suddenly the helicopter begins to vibrate and drift off its target. Fox looks toward the sound coming from his right and his eyes widen in fear as he sees the STAR MAN's ship looming over him.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (to the pilot) Lock in.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The spacecraft passes over the top of the helicopter. The whirling downdraft emanating from the spaceship's underbelly yanks the Cobra away from Jenny and the STAR MAN and whips it into a spin which gets faster and faster until it disintegrates and falls to the desert floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jenny and the STAR MAN shield their faces against the DUST STORM that billows under the WHINING DESCENT of the spacecraft. It settles into a landing across the dirt road resting on its three pods. With a crack, a cone of bright white light blasts from the underside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jenny nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The STAR MAN puts his arms around her and holds her tight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He kisses the tears out of her eyes, then full on the mouth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The STAR MAN steps back and places a hand on Jenny's stomach.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He turns from her and walks to his ship. Jenny watches him go, then remembers something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She gets the Webster's Dictionary and the Columbia History of the World from the Camaro and runs to the STAR MAN. He takes them and kisses her again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jenny backs away as the STAR MAN walks under the ship into the white light. He waves one last time to Jenny and is swallowed into the ship by the light.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Well...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I must go.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What do I do now?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You say you love me and kiss me 'goodbye.'
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I love you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (her head on his shoulder) I'm never going to see you again, am I?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I love you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Tell the baby about me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I will.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Goodbye.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Wait!!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thank you, Jennyhaydn.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Jenny turns away from the stinging sand as the space-craft lifts off. When she looks again, it is high and moving over the foothills. A banking turn brings it back. The ship dips low over her, rocks itself in a gesture of farewell, then shoots off into the stars. When she can no longer see it, Jenny drops her wave with a sigh and starts back toward the Camaro. Over her walk, we SUPER:
direction.name: direction

result.heading: JENNY HAYDN GAVE BIRTH TO AN EIGHT-POUND, SEVEN-OUNCE BABY BOY ON MARCH 10TH
